thread.title: Island that inspired National Trust finally given to group
thread.title_full: Island that inspired National Trust finally given to group

title: Island that inspired National Trust finally given to group
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Island that inspired National Trust finally given to group 25 February 2017 Last updated at 11:07 GMT 
The island that inspired the foundation of the National Trust has been gifted to the conservation charity after more than a century in private hands. 
Sitting in the middle of the Lake District, Grasmere Island was left to the Trust by its former owner in her will. 
Dave Guest has been for a visit. Read more
